channel.title: Sony to use Google Chrome
channel.description:
Google browser gets Sony foothold Sony personal computers are now available with Google's Chrome internet browser following a deal struck between the two technology giants this summer. This is the first such deal that Google has signed with a PC maker. Google said it plans to tie up further deals as it looks to promote the browser it launched last year. Chrome lags well behind Microsoft's market-leading Internet Explorer and Mozilla Foundation's Firefox browsers in market share. Internet Explorer is used by more than two-thirds of all internet users, while Chrome is used by less than 3%, according to web firm Net Applications. "User response to Google Chrome has been outstanding, and we're continuing to explore ways to make Chrome accessible to even more people," Google said. Some Sony PCs are already running Chrome as a result of the deal.
sauce: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8231184.stm

item.title: Sony to use Google Chrome
item.dc:creator: @933pm 933pm
item.description:
@933pm wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:30, topic:299465”]Chrome is almost the same as safari because both use Webkit. Chrome has it’s own share of differences though, including having each tab be inside a different process. So if one website doesn’t make the browser unhappy, only the tab you’re in will fail, not the entire browser.

Also <3 to chrome’s incognito mode.[/quote]

You mean pr0nz mode?

Read full topic

item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Chrome is almost the same as safari because both use Webkit. Chrome has it’s own share of differences though, including having each tab be inside a different process. So if one website doesn’t make the browser unhappy, only the tab you’re in will fail, not the entire browser.

Also <3 to chrome’s incognito mode.

item.title: Sony to use Google Chrome
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:23, topic:299465”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=395796.msg2941201#msg2941201 date=1251900009]

just launch ff and chrome and see which has more features

Chrome does exactly what a web browser needs to do, browse the web… You don’t need all those fancy addons and whatnot to make firefox better, surely having those addons means that firefox isn’t adequate and needs modifying ?
[/quote]it lacks simplistic things like a javascript error console (although i believe there is an add-on, but still doesnt explain why it lacks such a basic feature). also, i have seen it cause problems after programming a site that is perfectly compatible with IE6+, Opera, Firefox and Netscape. it does not have 100% correct use of standards. if i encounter another error like the one i did a few months ago, ill post.

ps. i think i showed nueb35 the error when i had it. im pretty sure it was something regarding calling objects from within forms[/quote]
Except it does have a JavaScript console? The button to the right of the address bar, click that then go down to developer, you got ‘View Source’, ‘Debug JavaScript’, ‘JavaScript Console’ and ‘Task Manager’.

And it should have full use of standards, because it uses the apple webkit, chrome is basically identical to safari.

Read full topic

Of course I only changed when I woke up one morning, came to my computer, and realised that firefox was using about 600MB of RAM. :o[/quote]

Tell me about it! But I do miss my extensions!

item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:9, topic:299465”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=395796.msg2940555#msg2940555 date=1251847436]

I use google chrome, I don’t like Firefox because its clunky and is a complete memory whore. Chrome on the other hand uses pretty much no memory, and loads pages much faster than firefox ever has.

facts or stfu…
[/quote]
I launch Chrome its up in 1 - 2 seconds, firefox is about 10 seconds before it even shows signs of doing anything, then it crashes twice trying to show me my homepage.[/quote]

that’s not a real benchmark asshat… google chrome may be better but you are doing a terrible job of convincing me otherwise…
